article:
Darna (2022 TV series)

Darna is a 2022 Philippine superhero television series based on the Mars Ravelo's comic book character of the same name. The series is a reboot of the 2005 television series of the same name and stars Jane de Leon as the titular character. The series premiered on August 15, 2022, on Kapamilya Channel and A2Z.

# Plot

The series follows the story of Narda Custodio, a young woman who discovers a magical stone that gives her superhuman powers. As Darna, she uses her powers to fight against evil forces that threaten the world. Alongside her brother Ding and her friends, Darna battles against various villains, including the main antagonist, Regina, who seeks to destroy the world.

# Cast and characters

## Lead cast

* Jane de Leon as Narda Custodio / Darna
* Joshua Garcia as Ding Custodio
* Janella Salvador as Regina
* Zaijian Jaranilla as Ricardo "Ric" Custodio

## Supporting cast

* Rio Locsin as Leonor Custodio
* Simon Ibarra as Mayor Zaldy Guevarra
* Richard Quan as Dr. Eric Gabriel
* Viveika Ravanes as Valentina
* Marvin Yap as Brian Robles
* Kira Balinger as Gwendolyn "Gwen" Flores
* Gerardo Villar as Francisco "Paco" Salazar

## Special participation

* Iza Calzado as the voice of the White Darna
* Joshua Colet as the young Ding Custodio
* Kenzo Gutierrez as the young Ricardo "Ric" Custodio

## Cameo appearances

* Marian Rivera as the original Darna
* Angel Locsin as the previous Darna

## Other supporting cast

* Mark Manicad as SPO1 Victor Gabriel
* Jeffrey Santos as SPO2 Ernesto "Erning" Salazar
* Jennie Gabriel as Lourdes "Lorie" Salazar
* Zeppi Borromeo as Julius "Juju" Velasco

# Production

## Development

The series was first announced in 2019, with Liza Soberano set to play the lead role. However, due to creative differences and scheduling conflicts, Soberano backed out of the project. Jane de Leon was later cast as the new Darna, and the series underwent a major revamp. The show was produced by JRB Creative Production, in association with Mars Ravelo's estate.

## Casting

The casting process for the series was extensive, with de Leon undergoing rigorous training to prepare for the role of Darna. The rest of the cast was assembled through a series of auditions and callbacks. Janella Salvador was cast as the main antagonist, Regina, while Joshua Garcia and Zaijian Jaranilla were cast as Ding and Ric, respectively.

## Filming

Principal photography for the series began in June 2022 and wrapped up in November 2022. The show was filmed on location in various parts of the Philippines, including Manila, Pampanga, and Batangas. The series' action scenes were choreographed by stunt coordinator, Alex Tomboc.

## Marketing

The series' marketing campaign was launched in July 2022, with a series of promotional posters and teasers released on social media. The show's official trailer was released on August 1, 2022, and generated significant buzz online.

## Music

The series' theme song, "Darna," was performed by Jane de Leon and was released on August 15, 2022. The show's original score was composed by Teresa Barrozo.

# International broadcast

## Singapore, Indonesia and Africa

The series premiered on August 15, 2022, on Kapamilya Channel and A2Z in the Philippines. It also aired on The Filipino Channel (TFC) in Singapore, Indonesia, and Africa.

# Reception

## Critical response

The series received generally positive reviews from critics, with many praising de Leon's performance as Darna. The show's action scenes and special effects were also praised, with some critics noting that they were among the best in Philippine television.

## Ratings

The series' premiere episode was a ratings success, with a 34.6% audience share in the Philippines. The show's ratings continued to rise throughout its run, with the finale episode reaching a peak audience share of 44.8%.

## Pre-release

The series' pre-release buzz was significant, with many fans eagerly anticipating the show's premiere. The show's promotional posters and teasers generated significant buzz online, with some fans speculating about the show's plot and characters.

## Weekend debut

The series' weekend debut was a success, with the show's first two episodes generating significant buzz online. The show's action scenes and special effects were praised by fans, who also noted that the show's pacing was well-balanced.

## Finale reception

The series' finale episode was a ratings success, with a peak audience share of 44.8% in the Philippines. The episode's conclusion was praised by fans, who noted that it was a satisfying end to the series.

# Awards and nominations

The series won several awards, including the Best TV Series award at the 2022 PMPC Star Awards for TV. De Leon also won the Best Actress award for her performance as Darna.

# Reruns

The series' reruns began airing on January 2, 2023, on Kapamilya Channel and A2Z.

2023 Chicago Mayoral Election

The 2023 Chicago mayoral election was held on February 28, 2023, to elect the Mayor of Chicago. The election was non-partisan, with all candidates appearing on the same ballot. Incumbent Mayor Lori Lightfoot was eligible to run for re-election, but she ultimately lost in the first round.

# Candidates

## Advanced to the runoff

Two candidates advanced to the runoff election, which was held on April 4, 2023:

* Brandon Johnson, Cook County Commissioner
* Paul Vallas, former CEO of Chicago Public Schools

## Eliminated in the first round

The following candidates were eliminated in the first round:

* Lori Lightfoot, incumbent Mayor of Chicago
* Kam Buckner, Illinois State Representative
* Ja'Mal Green, activist and entrepreneur
* Sophia King, Chicago Alderwoman
* Roderick Sawyer, Chicago Alderman
* Willie Wilson, businessman and perennial candidate

* U.S. Representative Danny Davis, who failed to submit the required number of valid signatures

## First round campaign

The first round campaign was marked by a crowded field of candidates and a lack of clear frontrunners. Incumbent Mayor Lori Lightfoot faced criticism for her handling of crime and public safety, while her opponents sought to capitalize on her unpopularity. Brandon Johnson and Paul Vallas emerged as the top two candidates, with Johnson positioning himself as a progressive alternative to Lightfoot and Vallas touting his experience as a former schools CEO.

article:
China Eastern Airlines Flight 5735
==============================

China Eastern Airlines Flight 5735 was a scheduled domestic passenger flight that crashed on March 21, 2022, in Guangxi, China. The Boeing 737-800 aircraft was operating from Kunming Changshui International Airport to Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport when it suddenly descended and crashed into a mountainous area in Wuzhou, Guangxi. All 132 people on board were killed in the accident.

Flight
------

China Eastern Airlines Flight 5735 was a scheduled passenger flight that departed from Kunming Changshui International Airport (KMG) at 1:16 PM local time (05:16 UTC) on March 21, 2022. The flight was bound for Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport (CAN), with an estimated flight time of approximately 2 hours and 30 minutes. The flight was operated by a Boeing 737-800 aircraft registered as B-1791.

Background
----------

### Aircraft

The Boeing 737-800 aircraft involved in the accident was registered as B-1791 and had a serial number of 41474. The aircraft was first delivered to China Eastern Airlines in June 2015 and had accumulated approximately 18,000 flight hours and 8,800 cycles (takeoffs and landings) at the time of the accident.

### Passengers and crew

There were 132 people on board Flight 5735, consisting of 123 passengers and 9 crew members. The passengers included 65 men and 58 women, with the majority being Chinese citizens. There were also two foreign nationals on board, one from Hong Kong and one from Indonesia.

Emergency response and recovery
-----------------------------

The accident occurred at 2:38 PM local time (06:38 UTC) on March 21, 2022, when the aircraft crashed into a mountainous area in Wuzhou, Guangxi. Emergency responders were immediately dispatched to the scene, and search and rescue operations were carried out in the following hours.

Recovery efforts were hindered by the remote location of the crash site and the challenging terrain. Rescue teams had to navigate through dense forests and steep hills to reach the site, where they found widespread debris and a large impact crater.

Investigation
-------------

### Initial investigation

The initial investigation into the accident was led by the Civil Aviation Administration of China (CAAC), with assistance from the National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) of the United States.

Preliminary findings indicated that the aircraft had suddenly descended from a cruising altitude of 29,000 feet (8,848 meters) to a lower altitude before crashing into the mountain. The exact cause of the accident was not immediately clear.

### Preliminary report

A preliminary report on the accident was released by the CAAC on March 24, 2022. The report stated that the aircraft had experienced a sudden loss of altitude and airspeed, followed by a steep descent into the mountain.

The report also noted that the flight data recorder (FDR) and cockpit voice recorder (CVR) had been recovered from the crash site and were being analyzed.

### Media reports of the investigation

Media reports have suggested that the investigation is focusing on a number of factors, including pilot error, mechanical failure, and air traffic control issues.

Some reports have suggested that the pilots may have lost control of the aircraft, possibly due to a loss of situational awareness or a medical emergency.

Other reports have pointed to possible mechanical issues with the aircraft, including problems with the autopilot system or the engines.

### Interim report

An interim report on the accident is expected to be released by the CAAC in the coming months. The report will provide a more detailed analysis of the accident and its causes.

Reactions
---------

### Domestic

The accident has sparked widespread outrage and grief in China, with many people taking to social media to express their condolences to the families of the victims.

The government has promised a thorough investigation into the accident and has pledged to take steps to improve aviation safety in China.

### International

The accident has also been met with shock and sadness around the world, with many countries offering condolences to the families of the victims.

The International Air Transport Association (IATA) has expressed its condolences and has offered assistance to the Chinese authorities in their investigation.

article:
United States House Select Committee on the January 6 Attack

The United States House Select Committee on the January 6 Attack is a select committee established by the United States House of Representatives on June 30, 2021, to investigate the January 6 United States Capitol attack. The committee is composed of nine members, with seven Democrats and two Republicans. The committee's investigation aims to identify the causes and consequences of the attack, as well as to make recommendations to prevent similar events in the future.

# History

The January 6 United States Capitol attack occurred on January 6, 2021, when a mob of supporters of then-President Donald Trump stormed the United States Capitol, resulting in the deaths of five people and injuring many others. In the aftermath of the attack, there were widespread calls for an investigation into the events leading up to and during the attack.

On January 25, 2021, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced that she would establish a 9/11-style commission to investigate the attack. However, on May 28, 2021, the Senate failed to pass a bill establishing an independent commission, with 54 senators voting in favor and 35 against. The bill required 60 votes to pass.

Following the failure of the independent commission bill, Pelosi announced on June 24, 2021, that she would establish a select committee to investigate the attack. The committee was formally established on June 30, 2021, with seven Democrats and two Republicans. The committee's first public hearing was held on July 27, 2021.

# Members

The United States House Select Committee on the January 6 Attack has nine members, with seven Democrats and two Republicans. The members are:

* Bennie Thompson (D-MS), Chairman
* Zoe Lofgren (D-CA)
* Adam Schiff (D-CA)
* Pete Aguilar (D-CA)
* Stephanie Murphy (D-FL)
* Jamie Raskin (D-MD)
* Elaine Luria (D-VA)
* Liz Cheney (R-WY)
* Adam Kinzinger (R-IL)

# Investigation

The committee's investigation has focused on several key areas, including the events leading up to the attack, the attack itself, and the aftermath.

## Simultaneous investigations by the Justice Department

The committee's investigation has been conducted in parallel with investigations by the United States Department of Justice. On January 13, 2021, the Justice Department announced that it would be investigating the attack, and on March 5, 2021, it announced that it would be investigating Trump's role in the attack.

## Information received from Mark Meadows

On December 1, 2021, the committee received over 6,000 pages of documents from Mark Meadows, Trump's former chief of staff. The documents included emails, text messages, and other communications that shed light on the events leading up to the attack.

## Obstacles

The committee's investigation has faced several obstacles, including:

### Release of documents from the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA)

In January 2022, the committee requested that the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) release documents related to the attack. However, Trump attempted to block the release of the documents, citing executive privilege. On January 19, 2022, the Supreme Court ruled that the documents could be released.

### Republicans not testifying

Several high-profile Republicans, including Trump and Meadows, have refused to testify before the committee.

### Secret Service, DHS and Pentagon text messages deleted

In July 2022, it was revealed that the Secret Service, Department of Homeland Security (DHS), and Pentagon had deleted text messages related to the attack.

### Trump funding legal defense of Republican witnesses

In July 2022, it was reported that Trump was funding the legal defense of several Republican witnesses who had been subpoenaed by the committee.

### Republican National Committee (RNC) claiming committee is illegitimate

The Republican National Committee (RNC) has repeatedly claimed that the committee is illegitimate and that its investigation is a "witch hunt."

# Public findings

The committee has held several public hearings and released several reports detailing its findings.

## 2021 public hearings

The committee's first public hearing was held on July 27, 2021, and featured testimony from four police officers who had responded to the attack. The committee held several additional public hearings in 2021, featuring testimony from other witnesses, including Trump's former attorney general, William Barr.

## 2022 public hearings

In 2022, the committee held several additional public hearings, featuring testimony from witnesses including Trump's former press secretary, Kayleigh McEnany, and Trump's former advisor, Peter Navarro.

## Criminal referrals

On December 19, 2022, the committee voted to refer Trump and several other individuals to the Justice Department for potential prosecution.

### Impact on other investigations

The committee's findings and referrals have had an impact on other investigations, including the Justice Department's investigation into Trump's role in the attack.

## Witness testimony transcripts

The committee has released transcripts of witness testimony, providing a detailed record of the events leading up to and during the attack.

# Final report

The committee's final report was released on December 22, 2022.

## Before publication

Before the report's publication, the committee voted to release the executive summary, which outlined the key findings and recommendations.

## Summary

The report's executive summary outlined the committee's key findings, including:

* Trump's role in the attack, including his efforts to overturn the 2020 presidential election
* The failure of law enforcement agencies to prepare for the attack
* The impact of the attack on the victims and their families

## Full report

The full report provided a detailed account of the committee's investigation, including:

* A timeline of the events leading up to and during the attack
* Transcripts of witness testimony
* Analysis of the committee's findings and recommendations

# Timeline of proceedings

## 2021

### July 2021

* July 27, 2021: The committee's first public hearing is held, featuring testimony from four police officers who responded to the attack.

### August 2021

* August 25, 2021: The committee issues its first subpoenas, targeting several individuals who had been involved in the planning of the attack.

### September 2021

* September 23, 2021: The committee holds its second public hearing, featuring testimony from Trump's former attorney general, William Barr.

### October 2021

* October 13, 2021: The committee issues subpoenas to several high-profile Republicans, including Trump and Meadows.

### November 2021

* November 9, 2021: The committee holds its third public hearing, featuring testimony from several witnesses who had been involved in the planning of the attack.

### December 2021

* December 1, 2021: The committee receives over 6,000 pages of documents from Mark Meadows.

## 2022

### January 2022

* January 6, 2022: The committee marks the one-year anniversary of the attack, releasing a statement and holding a moment of silence.

### February 2022

* February 9, 2022: The committee issues subpoenas to several individuals who had been involved in the planning of the attack.

* March 2, 2022: The committee holds its fourth public hearing, featuring testimony from several witnesses who had been involved in the planning of the attack.

Chevalier de Saint-Georges
==========================

Joseph Bologne, Chevalier de Saint-Georges (1745-1799) was a French composer, conductor, and violinist of African descent. He was one of the most accomplished and celebrated musicians of his time, known for his exceptional talent, innovative compositions, and charismatic personality. Saint-Georges' life was marked by numerous achievements, including being one of the first composers of African descent to gain widespread recognition in Europe.

Early Life
----------

Joseph Bologne was born on December 25, 1745, in Guadeloupe, a French colony in the Caribbean. His father, George de Bologne Saint-Georges, was a wealthy plantation owner, and his mother, Nanon, was a slave. Joseph was the only child of this union, and his parents' relationship was considered scandalous due to the societal norms of the time.

Joseph's early life was marked by privilege and opportunity. He received a comprehensive education, including music lessons, and was encouraged to develop his talents. In 1753, his father took him to Paris, where he continued his education and began to make a name for himself as a musician.

Musical Life and Career
----------------------

Saint-Georges' musical career was marked by numerous successes and innovations. He began by performing as a violinist in various orchestras and ensembles, quickly gaining a reputation for his exceptional talent and technical skill. In 1769, he became the conductor of the prestigious Concert des Amateurs, a position he held until 1781.

As a composer, Saint-Georges was known for his innovative and eclectic style, which blended elements of classical, operatic, and folk music. He wrote numerous operas, symphonies, concertos, and chamber music pieces, many of which were performed to great acclaim during his lifetime.

Operas
--------

Saint-Georges wrote several operas, including "Ernestine" (1777), "La Partie de Chasse" (1778), and "L'Amant anonyme" (1780). His operas were known for their witty dialogue, complex characters, and innovative musical styles.

Social Life in Paris
--------------------

Saint-Georges was a prominent figure in Parisian society, known for his charisma, wit, and elegance. He was a frequent guest at salons and soirees, where he would perform and socialize with the city's elite.

### St. Georges assaulted

Despite his success and popularity, Saint-Georges faced numerous challenges and prejudices due to his racial background. In 1787, he was assaulted by a group of thugs who were allegedly hired by a rival composer. The incident was widely publicized and sparked outrage among Saint-Georges' supporters.

Two Trips to London
-------------------

Saint-Georges made two trips to London, the first in 1787 and the second in 1790. During his first trip, he performed as a violinist and conductor, and was received with great acclaim by the British public.

### Second trip

During his second trip, Saint-Georges was invited to perform at the Royal Court, where he conducted a performance of his opera "L'Amant anonyme." The performance was a huge success, and Saint-Georges was hailed as a musical genius by the British press.

Lille
------

In 1791, Saint-Georges moved to Lille, where he became the conductor of the city's orchestra. He remained in Lille until 1792, when he returned to Paris.

Military Career
----------------

During the French Revolution, Saint-Georges joined the military and became a colonel in the Légion St-Georges, a regiment of African and Caribbean soldiers. He fought bravely in several battles, including the Battle of Valmy.

Possible Saint-Domingue visit
-----------------------------

There is some evidence to suggest that Saint-Georges visited Saint-Domingue (present-day Haiti) in 1792, although the details of this trip are unclear.

------

Saint-Georges died on June 10, 1799, at the age of 53. He was buried in a private ceremony in Paris.

-----

Saint-Georges' home in Paris was a gathering place for musicians, artists, and intellectuals. He was known for his generosity and hospitality, and his home was always filled with music, laughter, and conversation.

------

article:
Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves is a 2023 American fantasy adventure film directed by Jonathan Goldstein and John Francis Daley, and written by Goldstein, Daley, and Michael Gilio. The film is based on the popular tabletop role-playing game Dungeons & Dragons, created by Gary Gygax and Dave Arneson.

# Plot

The film follows a group of adventurers, including Edgin Darvis, aka "The Bard" (Chris Pine), a charismatic thief and musician; Holga Kilgore, aka "The Barbarian" (Michelle Rodriguez), a fierce warrior; Simon Aumar, aka "The Sorcerer" (Justice Smith), a young and inexperienced magic-user; and Doric, aka "The Druid" (Sophia Lillis), a half-elf who can shape-shift into various animal forms. The group is hired by a wealthy client to steal a powerful artifact, but things quickly go awry, and they find themselves on a quest to save the world from an ancient evil.

# Cast

The film features an ensemble cast, including Chris Pine, Michelle Rodriguez, Justice Smith, Sophia Lillis, Regé-Jean Page, and Hugh Grant. The cast underwent extensive training in sword fighting, archery, and other skills to prepare for their roles.

## Main cast

* Chris Pine as Edgin Darvis, aka "The Bard"
* Michelle Rodriguez as Holga Kilgore, aka "The Barbarian"
* Justice Smith as Simon Aumar, aka "The Sorcerer"
* Sophia Lillis as Doric, aka "The Druid"
* Regé-Jean Page as Xenk, a paladin
* Hugh Grant as Forge Fitzwilliam, a rogue

## Supporting cast

* Chloe Coleman as Sophie Darvis, Edgin's daughter
* Daisy Head as Red Wizard, a powerful sorceress
* Bradley Cooper as Marlamin, a powerful demon

# Production

## Development and casting

Development on the film began in 2015, with Warner Bros. Pictures acquiring the rights to adapt the Dungeons & Dragons franchise. Jonathan Goldstein and John Francis Daley were hired to direct and write the film, with Michael Gilio joining the writing team later. The cast was announced in 2020, with Chris Pine, Michelle Rodriguez, and Justice Smith among the first to be cast.

## Writing

The script was written by Goldstein, Daley, and Gilio, with input from the cast and other members of the production team. The writers drew inspiration from the original Dungeons & Dragons game, as well as other fantasy films and literature. The script underwent several revisions during production, with some scenes and characters being added or removed.

## Filming and visual effects

Principal photography began in April 2021 and wrapped in August 2021. The film was shot on location in Iceland and the United Kingdom, with some scenes also being filmed in studios in Los Angeles and London. The visual effects were created by Industrial Light & Magic, with the team using a combination of practical and CGI effects to bring the film's fantastical world to life.

# Music

The score was composed by Lorne Balfe, with the soundtrack featuring a mix of orchestral and choral pieces. The film's theme song, "Honor Among Thieves," was performed by Chris Pine and was released as a single in March 2023.

# Release

## Theatrical

The film was released in theaters on March 31, 2023, in the United States and the United Kingdom. It was released in other countries throughout April and May 2023.

## Home media

The film was released on digital platforms on May 30, 2023, and on DVD and Blu-ray on June 20, 2023.

# Marketing

## Promotion

The film's marketing campaign began in October 2022, with the release of the first teaser trailer. The trailer featured footage of the film's action sequences and introduced the main characters. A second trailer was released in January 2023, with a third trailer being released in March 2023.

## Tie-in literature and merchandise

A tie-in novel, "Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves - The Novelization," was released in March 2023. The novel was written by Chris Pine and Michael Gilio and expands on the film's story. Other merchandise, including toys, clothing, and accessories, was released in the months leading up to the film's release.

# Reception

## Box office

The film was a commercial success, grossing over $400 million worldwide. It opened at number one at the box office in the United States and the United Kingdom, with some of the film's showings selling out in advance.

## Critical response

The film received generally positive reviews from critics, with many praising the cast's performances and the film's action sequences. The film holds a 72% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with an average rating of 6.4/10.

## Accolades

The film was nominated for several awards, including a Saturn Award for Best Fantasy Film and a Visual Effects Society Award for Outstanding Visual Effects in a Visual Effects-Driven Film.

# Future

## Possible sequel

A sequel to the film is currently in development, with Goldstein and Daley set to return as directors and writers. The sequel is expected to continue the story of the main characters and introduce new characters and plotlines.

## Spin-off television series

A spin-off television series, "Dungeons & Dragons: The Adventure Continues," is currently in production. The series will follow a new group of adventurers as they embark on quests and battles in the world of Dungeons & Dragons.

2021–22 Premier League

The 2021–22 Premier League was the 30th season of the Premier League, the top English professional league for association football clubs, since its establishment in 1992. The season began on 13 August 2021 and concluded on 22 May 2022.

# Summary

## The race for first place

The 2021–22 Premier League season saw a closely contested title race between Manchester City and Liverpool. Manchester City, led by manager Pep Guardiola, ultimately emerged as champions, finishing one point ahead of Liverpool. The title was decided on the final day of the season, with Manchester City coming from behind to defeat Aston Villa 3–2 at the Etihad Stadium.

## Newcastle takeover

In October 2021, Newcastle United was taken over by a consortium backed by the Saudi Arabian Public Investment Fund (PIF). The takeover was met with controversy, with concerns raised about the human rights record of the Saudi Arabian government. The takeover was eventually approved by the Premier League, despite opposition from some clubs and human rights groups.

## COVID-19 outbreaks force postponements

The 2021–22 Premier League season was disrupted by COVID-19 outbreaks, with several matches postponed due to outbreaks among players and staff. The Premier League introduced new rules to allow matches to be postponed if a team had fewer than 14 available players.

## Abramovich sanctions

In March 2022, Chelsea owner Roman Abramovich was sanctioned by the UK government due to his alleged links to Russian President Vladimir Putin. The sanctions had a significant impact on Chelsea, with the club unable to sell tickets or merchandise.

## Final day climax

The final day of the season saw a thrilling climax, with Manchester City and Liverpool both in contention for the title. Manchester City came from behind to defeat Aston Villa 3–2, while Liverpool defeated Wolverhampton Wanderers 3–1. However, Manchester City's victory secured them the title, with Liverpool finishing one point behind.

article:
2023 Gabonese Coup d'état

The 2023 Gabonese coup d'état was a military takeover that occurred on August 30, 2023, in Gabon, a country located in Central Africa. The coup led to the ousting of President Ali Bongo Ondimba, who had been in power since 2009. The coup was carried out by a group of military officers who seized control of key government buildings and institutions in the capital city of Libreville.

#Background

Gabon has a history of political instability, with the country experiencing several coups and attempted coups since gaining independence from France in 1960. The country's politics have been dominated by the Bongo family, with Ali Bongo Ondimba succeeding his father, Omar Bongo, as president in 2009.

##2023 Elections

In the months leading up to the coup, Gabon had been preparing for presidential elections, which were scheduled to take place on August 26, 2023. The elections were seen as a test of President Bongo's popularity, as well as the country's democratic institutions. However, the elections were marred by allegations of irregularities and vote-rigging, with opposition candidates accusing the government of attempting to steal the election.

#Coup

The coup began on the evening of August 30, 2023, when a group of military officers seized control of key government buildings and institutions in Libreville. The officers, who were reportedly led by a group of senior military commanders, took control of the presidential palace, the national assembly, and the state television station.

##Events

The coup was marked by a series of dramatic events, including the arrest of several senior government officials, including the president's chief of staff and the minister of defense. The officers also took control of the country's major roads and highways, cutting off access to the capital city.

##Arrests of Ali Bongo and other officials

On the morning of August 31, 2023, President Bongo was arrested by the military officers and taken into custody. Several other senior government officials, including the prime minister and the speaker of the national assembly, were also arrested.

##Proclamation of Brice Oligui as interim president

Later on the same day, the military officers announced that they had appointed Brice Oligui, a former minister of defense, as interim president. Oligui, who had been a key figure in the coup, was sworn in as president in a ceremony at the presidential palace.

#Aftermath

The coup led to a period of uncertainty and instability in Gabon, with many citizens expressing concerns about the country's future.

##Formation of a new government

In the days following the coup, Oligui began to form a new government, appointing a number of senior officials to key positions. The new government included several former opposition leaders, who had been critical of the Bongo regime.

##Bongo's release

On September 5, 2023, President Bongo was released from custody, after being held for several days by the military officers. Bongo, who had been in poor health for several years, was allowed to return to his home, where he was placed under house arrest.

#Reactions

The coup was met with a range of reactions, both domestically and internationally.

##Domestic

Many Gabonese citizens expressed relief at the ousting of President Bongo, who had been seen as increasingly authoritarian and out of touch with the country's needs. However, others expressed concerns about the coup, which was seen as a setback for the country's democratic institutions.

##International

The international community was quick to condemn the coup, with many countries calling for the restoration of democratic rule in Gabon. The African Union and the European Union both issued statements expressing concern about the situation, and calling for calm and restraint.

article:
Matty Healy
================

Matthew Timothy Healy, known professionally as Matty Healy, is a British singer, songwriter, and record producer. He is best known as the lead vocalist and guitarist of the rock band The 1975. Born on April 19, 1989, in London, England, Healy has become a prominent figure in the music industry, recognized for his distinctive voice, introspective songwriting, and energetic live performances.

Early Life
-----------

Matty Healy was born in London, England, to Tim Healy, a British actor, and Denise Welch, a British actress and television presenter. He has a brother, Louis Healy, who is also an actor. Healy's parents divorced when he was young, and he spent his childhood moving between London and Newcastle upon Tyne. He attended the independent Cheadle Hulme School in Stockport, Cheshire, where he met his future bandmates, Adam Hann, Ross MacDonald, and George Daniel.

Career
-------

### 2002–2011: Beginnings, and early years of the 1975

Matty Healy began his music career at a young age, playing guitar and singing in various bands. In 2002, he formed a band called Me and You Versus Them with his friends Adam Hann, Ross MacDonald, and George Daniel. The band played gigs in the Manchester area, performing a mix of punk and indie rock music. In 2009, the band changed its name to The 1975, inspired by a Jack Kerouac book inscription that read "1st June, The 1975."

### 2012–2014: Rise to fame

The 1975 released their debut EP, "Facedown," in 2012, which gained them attention from record labels and critics. In 2013, they signed with Dirty Hit Records and released their second EP, "Sex." The band's blend of indie rock, pop, and electronica resonated with audiences, and they began to build a loyal fan base.

### 2015–2017: Breakthrough

The 1975 released their self-titled debut album in 2013, which was a commercial success, reaching the top 30 in the UK Albums Chart. The album spawned several hit singles, including "The City" and "Girls." In 2016, the band released their second album, "I Like It When You Sleep, for You Are So Beautiful yet So Unaware of It," which debuted at number one in the UK Albums Chart and reached the top 10 in several countries.

### 2018–2021: Critical acclaim

The 1975 released their third album, "A Brief Inquiry into Online Relationships," in 2018, which received widespread critical acclaim and commercial success. The album explored themes of technology, social media, and modern life, and featured hit singles like "Give Yourself a Try" and "TooTimeTooTimeTooTime." In 2020, the band released their fourth album, "Notes on a Conditional Form," which continued their experimental approach to music and explored themes of climate change, politics, and personal relationships.

### 2022–present: Further success

In 2022, The 1975 released their fifth album, "Being Funny in a Foreign Language," which debuted at number one in the UK Albums Chart and received positive reviews from critics. The album features a more stripped-back and introspective sound, with lyrics that explore themes of love, relationships, and identity.

Artistry
---------

### Influences

Matty Healy's music is influenced by a wide range of artists and genres, including indie rock, pop, electronica, and punk. He has cited artists like Talking Heads, David Bowie, and Radiohead as major influences, as well as contemporary artists like Kendrick Lamar and Frank Ocean.

### Voice

Healy's distinctive voice is characterized by its warm, soulful tone and wide vocal range. He is known for his expressive and emotive delivery, which brings depth and nuance to his lyrics.

### Songwriting

Healy is a prolific songwriter, and his lyrics often explore themes of love, relationships, identity, and social commentary. He is known for his introspective and personal approach to songwriting, which has resonated with audiences and critics alike.

### Performance style

Matty Healy is a charismatic and energetic live performer, known for his dynamic stage presence and engaging audience interactions. He is often praised for his ability to connect with audiences and create a sense of community and connection at his live shows.

Legacy
--------

### Healywave

Matty Healy has been credited with helping to shape the sound of contemporary indie rock, particularly in the UK. His influence can be heard in a range of artists and bands, from Pale Waves to Arlo Parks. The term "Healywave" has been used to describe the distinctive sound and style of The 1975, which has become a benchmark for indie rock bands.

Political views and activism
---------------------------

Matty Healy is known for his outspoken views on politics and social issues. He has been a vocal advocate for LGBTQ+ rights, climate change mitigation, and gender equality.

### LGBTQ+ rights

Healy has been a long-time supporter of LGBTQ+ rights, and has used his platform to raise awareness and promote acceptance. He has been praised for his allyship and advocacy, and has been recognized as a role model for young LGBTQ+ people.

### Climate change mitigation

Healy has been a vocal critic of climate change and its impact on the environment. He has used his platform to raise awareness and promote action, and has been recognized for his commitment to sustainability and environmentalism.

### Gender issues

Healy has been a vocal advocate for gender equality and women's rights. He has used his platform to promote feminist values and challenge patriarchal attitudes, and has been recognized for his commitment to social justice.

### Religion

Healy has been open about his struggles with faith and spirituality, and has explored these themes in his music. He has been praised for his nuanced and thoughtful approach to spirituality, and has been recognized as a role model for young people exploring their own faith and spirituality.

Public image
-------------

Matty Healy is known for his charismatic and confident stage presence, as well as his introspective and emotional lyrics. He has been praised for his authenticity and vulnerability, and has been recognized as a role model for young people.

Personal life
-------------

Matty Healy is in a relationship with actress FKA twigs, and has been open about his struggles with addiction and mental health. He has used his platform to raise awareness and promote acceptance, and has been recognized for his commitment to mental health advocacy.

article:
2023 Michigan State University Shooting

On February 13, 2023, a mass shooting occurred at Michigan State University (MSU) in East Lansing, Michigan, United States. The incident resulted in the deaths of three students and injured five others. The shooting occurred in two separate locations on the university campus, sparking a massive police response and a lockdown of the campus.

# Shootings

The first shooting occurred at approximately 8:18 p.m. local time at Berkey Hall, a classroom building in the College of Social Science. A gunman entered a classroom where students were attending a night class and began firing shots. Two students were killed in this initial shooting. The second shooting occurred about 10 minutes later at the MSU Student Union, a building located in the heart of the campus. A third student was killed in this second shooting.

Police received multiple calls about the shootings, and officers responded quickly to the scene. They converged on the campus, searching for the gunman. A massive manhunt ensued, involving local, state, and federal law enforcement agencies. The campus was placed on lockdown, with students and faculty told to shelter in place.

# Victims

The three students killed in the shooting were identified as Alexandria Verner, Brian Fraser, and Arielle Anderson. Verner was a junior majoring in biology, Fraser was a sophomore majoring in computer science, and Anderson was a junior majoring in international relations. Five other students were injured in the shooting, including three who suffered serious injuries. The injured students were taken to local hospitals for treatment.

## Aftermath

The shooting sent shockwaves through the MSU community, with students, faculty, and staff struggling to come to terms with the tragedy. The university canceled classes for the remainder of the week, and counseling services were made available to those affected by the shooting. A vigil was held on campus, attended by thousands of students, faculty, and community members.

# Perpetrator

The gunman was identified as Anthony McRae, a 43-year-old man from Lansing, Michigan. McRae had no known connection to MSU or the victims. He was found dead off-campus with a self-inflicted gunshot wound, reportedly after taking his own life as police closed in on him. McRae had a history of mental health issues and had been known to law enforcement.

## Aftermath

McRae's motives for the shooting were not immediately clear. Police investigated his background and online activity, looking for any clues that might explain why he carried out the attack. The investigation was ongoing, with authorities seeking to determine whether McRae acted alone or if there were any other factors involved.

# Memorials and Vigils

In the days following the shooting, multiple memorials and vigils were held on campus and in the surrounding community. Thousands of students, faculty, and community members attended these events, paying tribute to the victims and showing support for those affected by the tragedy.

## Gun Violence Protest

On February 17, a protest was held on campus, with students and community members calling for action on gun violence. The protest was organized by student groups and advocacy organizations, with speakers demanding change and calling for stricter gun control laws.

## Permanent Memorial

In the weeks following the shooting, a permanent memorial was established on campus to honor the victims. The memorial featured a stone monument with the names of the three students killed, as well as a plaque with a message of hope and resilience.

## Lawsuits

In the months following the shooting, several lawsuits were filed against MSU and law enforcement agencies, alleging that they had failed to prevent the tragedy. The lawsuits claimed that the university and police had been negligent in their response to the shooting, and that they had not done enough to protect students and faculty.

# Responses

The shooting sparked a wide range of responses, from local and national leaders, advocacy groups, and the broader community.

## Gun Control Debate

The shooting reignited the debate over gun control, with advocates calling for stricter laws and opponents arguing that such laws would infringe on Second Amendment rights. National leaders weighed in on the issue, with some calling for action and others opposing new regulations.

## Connections to Other Shootings

The MSU shooting was seen as part of a larger pattern of gun violence in the United States, with many drawing connections to other recent mass shootings. Advocates and experts pointed to the need for a comprehensive approach to addressing gun violence, including improved mental health services and stricter gun control laws.

article:
2022 French Legislative Election

The 2022 French legislative election was held on June 12 and 19, 2022, to elect the 577 members of the 16th National Assembly of the French Fifth Republic. The election was a crucial test for President Emmanuel Macron's party, La République En Marche! (LREM), which had won a majority in the previous legislative election in 2017.

# Background

The 2022 legislative election was the first to be held after the 2022 presidential election, in which Emmanuel Macron was re-elected for a second term. The presidential election had seen a significant increase in support for the far-right and far-left parties, which had raised concerns about the potential for a hung parliament. Additionally, the election was held during a period of high inflation and economic uncertainty, which had become major issues in French politics.

# Electoral System

The French legislative election uses a two-round system, with a majority vote in each constituency. The country is divided into 577 constituencies, each electing one member of the National Assembly. In the first round, voters can choose from a list of candidates, and if no candidate receives more than 50% of the vote, a second round is held. In the second round, only the top two candidates from the first round, or candidates who received more than 12.5% of the vote, are eligible to participate.

# Dates

The first round of the legislative election was held on June 12, 2022, and the second round was held on June 19, 2022.

# Major Parties and Alliances

The major parties and alliances contesting the election were:

* La République En Marche! (LREM), the party of President Emmanuel Macron
* The Union of the Right and Centre, an alliance between The Republicans (LR) and the Union of Democrats and Independents (UDI)
* The New Ecological and Social People's Union (NUPES), an alliance between the Socialist Party (PS), La France Insoumise (LFI), Europe Ecology – The Greens (EELV), and the French Communist Party (PCF)
* The National Rally (RN), a far-right party led by Marine Le Pen
* The Reconquest! party, a far-right party led by Éric Zemmour

## Deputies not standing for reelection

Several high-profile deputies announced that they would not be standing for reelection, including former Prime Minister Édouard Philippe, former Interior Minister Christophe Castaner, and former Education Minister Jean-Michel Blanquer.

# Opinion Polls

Opinion polls in the run-up to the election suggested that the New Ecological and Social People's Union (NUPES) would win the most seats, followed closely by La République En Marche! (LREM). The Union of the Right and Centre was expected to lose seats, while the National Rally was expected to make gains.

# Results

## First Round

The first round of the election saw a low turnout, with just over 47% of eligible voters casting their ballots. The New Ecological and Social People's Union (NUPES) topped the poll, with over 25% of the vote, followed by La République En Marche! (LREM) with over 22%.

## Second Round

The second round of the election saw a slightly higher turnout, with just over 46% of eligible voters casting their ballots. La République En Marche! (LREM) won the most seats, with 245 deputies elected, followed by the New Ecological and Social People's Union (NUPES) with 131 deputies.

## National Results

The national results of the election were as follows:

* La République En Marche! (LREM): 245 seats
* New Ecological and Social People's Union (NUPES): 131 seats
* Union of the Right and Centre: 64 seats
* National Rally: 89 seats
* Reconquest!: 2 seats
* Others: 46 seats

## Results by Constituency

The results of the election varied significantly by constituency. La République En Marche! (LREM) won the most seats in the Île-de-France region, while the New Ecological and Social People's Union (NUPES) won the most seats in the Nord-Pas-de-Calais region.

## Electorate

Halloween Ends

Halloween Ends is a 2022 American slasher film directed by David Gordon Green and written by Green, Danny McBride, and Paul Brad Logan. The film is the final installment in the Halloween franchise and serves as a direct sequel to the 2021 film Halloween Kills.

# Plot

The film takes place four years after the events of Halloween Kills. Laurie Strode (Jamie Lee Curtis) has written a memoir about her experiences with Michael Myers, which has become a bestseller. However, she is struggling to cope with the trauma of her past and the loss of her loved ones. Meanwhile, Michael Myers (James Jude Courtney) is still on the loose, and a new masked killer has emerged in Haddonfield, Illinois.

As the story unfolds, Laurie becomes increasingly obsessed with the idea of confronting Michael and putting an end to the cycle of violence that has haunted her for decades. She begins to investigate the new killer, who is targeting young women in the town, and soon discovers a connection between the two.

The film's climax features a final confrontation between Laurie and Michael, which takes place in an abandoned warehouse on the outskirts of Haddonfield. The two engage in a brutal and intense fight, which ultimately ends with Laurie emerging victorious.

# Cast

* Jamie Lee Curtis as Laurie Strode
* James Jude Courtney as Michael Myers
* Andi Matichak as Allyson Nelson
* Will Patton as Deputy Frank Hawkins
* Kyle Richards as Lindsey Wallace
* Nancy Stephens as Marion Chambers
* Rohan Campbell as Corey Cunningham
* Jesse C. Boyd as Officer Doug Mulaney

# Production

## Development

Halloween Ends was first announced in July 2020, when Universal Pictures revealed plans to release the film in October 2022. David Gordon Green, who directed the previous two films in the franchise, returned to helm the project. Danny McBride and Paul Brad Logan, who co-wrote Halloween Kills, also returned to write the screenplay.

## Writing

According to Green, the script for Halloween Ends was written with the intention of creating a more intimate and personal story than the previous two films. The director wanted to explore the emotional toll that the events of the franchise had taken on Laurie Strode, and to create a sense of closure for the character.

## Casting

Jamie Lee Curtis, who has played Laurie Strode in the franchise since the original 1978 film, returned to reprise her role in Halloween Ends. James Jude Courtney, who played Michael Myers in the previous two films, also returned to play the iconic villain.

## Filming

Principal photography for Halloween Ends began in January 2022, and took place over the course of six weeks in Wilmington, North Carolina. The film's budget was significantly lower than that of Halloween Kills, which allowed the production team to focus on creating a more contained and intimate story.

## Post-production

Post-production on Halloween Ends began in March 2022, and took place over the course of several months. The film's editor, Tim Alverson, worked closely with Green to create a sense of tension and suspense throughout the film.

## Music

The score for Halloween Ends was composed by John Carpenter, who has created the music for the franchise since the original 1978 film. Carpenter's score features a mix of electronic and orchestral elements, and helps to create a sense of unease and tension throughout the film.

# Release

Halloween Ends was released in theaters on October 14, 2022, and received a wide release in the United States and other countries.

## Home media

The film was released on home media on December 27, 2022, and is available on DVD, Blu-ray, and digital platforms.

# Reception

## Audience viewership

Halloween Ends was a commercial success, grossing over $130 million worldwide on a budget of $33 million. The film received a "B+" grade from audiences polled by CinemaScore, indicating a positive response to the film.

## Box office

The film's opening weekend box office was $40.1 million, which was lower than that of Halloween Kills but still a respectable total. The film's box office performance was likely affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, which had a significant impact on the film industry in 2022.

## Critical response

Halloween Ends received mixed reviews from critics, with some praising the film's intimate and personal story while others found it too slow and predictable. The film holds a 53% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 212 reviews.

## Accolades

# Future

Banjska Attack

The Banjska attack was a military assault that occurred on July 28, 1998, in the village of Banjska, Kosovo, during the Kosovo War. The attack resulted in significant casualties and destruction, leading to a major escalation of the conflict. This article provides an overview of the background, attack, aftermath, and reactions to the Banjska attack.

# Background

The Kosovo War was a conflict between the Yugoslav government, led by President Slobodan Milošević, and the Kosovo Liberation Army (KLA), a separatist group seeking independence for Kosovo. The conflict began in 1997 and escalated into a full-scale war in 1998. The Yugoslav government saw the KLA as a terrorist organization, while the KLA viewed itself as a legitimate force fighting for self-determination.

In the months leading up to the Banjska attack, tensions in Kosovo had increased, with both sides engaging in violent clashes. The Yugoslav government had launched a series of military operations aimed at crushing the KLA, while the KLA had stepped up its attacks on Yugoslav security forces.

# Attack

The Banjska attack occurred on July 28, 1998, when a group of Yugoslav security forces, including police and military units, launched a surprise assault on the village of Banjska, which was a stronghold of the KLA. The attack was intended to capture or kill KLA leaders and disrupt the group's operations in the area.

## Weaponry

The Yugoslav security forces used a range of heavy weaponry during the attack, including tanks, artillery, and mortars. The KLA, on the other hand, was largely equipped with small arms and light infantry weapons.

## Attackers

The Yugoslav security forces involved in the attack included units from the Yugoslav Army (VJ) and the Ministry of Internal Affairs (MUP). The MUP units were primarily responsible for the ground assault, while the VJ provided artillery and air support.

## Casualties

The Banjska attack resulted in significant casualties on both sides. The KLA reported that at least 20 of its fighters were killed, while the Yugoslav government claimed that over 30 KLA members were killed. In addition, several civilians were killed or injured during the attack.

# Aftermath

The Banjska attack marked a significant escalation of the Kosovo War. The Yugoslav government's use of heavy force against the KLA and civilians led to widespread condemnation from the international community.

## Resolutions

The international community responded to the Banjska attack with a series of resolutions aimed at ending the conflict.

### Kosovo and Albania

The governments of Kosovo and Albania condemned the attack and called for international intervention to protect the civilian population. The KLA also stepped up its attacks on Yugoslav security forces in response to the assault.

### European Union

The European Union (EU) condemned the Banjska attack and called for a ceasefire. The EU also imposed economic sanctions on the Yugoslav government in an effort to pressure it to end the conflict.

## Serbian state involvement

The Banjska attack highlighted the involvement of the Serbian state in the Kosovo War. The Yugoslav government, led by President Milošević, was accused of orchestrating the attack and of using disproportionate force against civilians.

## Serbian military buildup and base construction

In the aftermath of the Banjska attack, the Yugoslav government began to build up its military presence in Kosovo. The government constructed new military bases and deployed additional troops to the region, leading to increased tensions with the KLA and the international community.

# Reactions

The Banjska attack elicited strong reactions from both sides of the conflict, as well as from the international community.

## Kosovo

The KLA condemned the attack and vowed to continue fighting for independence. The Kosovo Albanian population also responded with widespread protests and demonstrations against the Yugoslav government.

## Serbia

The Yugoslav government defended the attack as a legitimate operation against a terrorist organization. President Milošević also accused the international community of bias and of supporting the KLA.

## International

The international community widely condemned the Banjska attack and called for an end to the conflict. The United Nations Security Council passed a resolution condemning the attack and calling for a ceasefire. The United States and other Western countries also imposed economic sanctions on the Yugoslav government and provided humanitarian aid to the affected population.

The Banjska attack marked a significant turning point in the Kosovo War. The use of heavy force by the Yugoslav government against civilians and the KLA led to widespread condemnation and increased international pressure to end the conflict. The attack also highlighted the need for a peaceful resolution to the conflict, which ultimately led to the deployment of international peacekeeping forces to Kosovo in 1999.

article:
Salman Rushdie

Sir Salman Rushdie is a British-Indian novelist and essayist. Born on June 19, 1947, in Bombay, British India, Rushdie is one of the most celebrated and influential writers of his generation. His works often blend elements of magic realism, historical fiction, and postcolonialism, exploring themes of identity, culture, politics, and the human condition. Throughout his career, Rushdie has received numerous accolades, including the Booker Prize, the Knighthood, and the National Book Critics Circle Award.

#Early life and education

Rushdie was born into a Muslim family in Bombay (now Mumbai), India. His father, Anis Ahmed Rushdie, was a Cambridge-educated lawyer, and his mother, Negin Bhatt, was a teacher. Rushdie has three sisters. After India gained independence in 1947, the family moved to Pakistan, where Rushdie spent his early childhood. He returned to India in 1957 and attended the Cathedral and John Connon School in Bombay.

In 1961, Rushdie moved to England to attend Rugby School, a prestigious public school. He later studied history at King's College, Cambridge, where he earned a Master's degree in 1968. During his time at Cambridge, Rushdie became interested in writing and began to develop his skills as a writer.

#Career

##Copywriter

After graduating from Cambridge, Rushdie worked as a copywriter for the advertising agency Ogilvy & Mather. He later moved to the agency Ayer Barker, where he worked on accounts such as the American Express and the Daily Mirror. Rushdie has credited his experience as a copywriter with teaching him the importance of clarity and concision in writing.

##Literary works

###Early works and literary breakthrough, 1975–1987

Rushdie's first novel, "Grimus," was published in 1975. Although it received mixed reviews, the novel showcased Rushdie's unique blend of magical realism and postcolonial themes. His second novel, "Midnight's Children" (1981), was a major breakthrough, earning Rushdie the Booker Prize and the James Tait Black Memorial Prize.

"Midnight's Children" is a sweeping narrative that explores India's transition to independence through the eyes of a child born at midnight on August 15, 1947. The novel's innovative use of language, blend of history and fantasy, and exploration of themes such as identity, culture, and politics established Rushdie as a major literary talent.

###The Satanic Verses and Haroun and the Sea of Stories, 1988–1990

Rushdie's fourth novel, "The Satanic Verses" (1988), was a major controversy due to its depiction of the Prophet Muhammad and its use of Islamic themes. The novel was banned in several countries, and Rushdie received death threats. However, the novel also received widespread critical acclaim, including the Whitbread Prize for Best Novel.

"Haroun and the Sea of Stories" (1990) is a children's novel that explores the power of storytelling and the importance of imagination. The novel is a tribute to Rushdie's own love of storytelling and his experiences as a writer.

###Further works, 1990s–2000s

Rushdie's subsequent novels, including "The Moor's Last Sigh" (1995), "The Ground Beneath Her Feet" (1999), and "Fury" (2001), continued to explore themes of identity, culture, and politics. "The Moor's Last Sigh" is a sweeping narrative that explores the history of India and the experiences of the Indian diaspora.

"The Ground Beneath Her Feet" is a novel that explores the intersection of music, politics, and culture in the context of India's independence movement. "Fury" is a novel that explores the experiences of a young writer struggling to find his place in the world.

###Later works, novels, and essays, 2015–2024

Rushdie's more recent works include "Two Years Eight Months and Twenty-Eight Nights" (2015), "The Golden House" (2017), and "Quichotte" (2019). "Two Years Eight Months and Twenty-Eight Nights" is a novel that explores the intersection of mythology, history, and politics in the context of India's independence movement.

"The Golden House" is a novel that explores the experiences of a wealthy family in contemporary America. "Quichotte" is a novel that explores the intersection of reality and fantasy in the context of contemporary America.

##Critical reception

Rushdie's works have received widespread critical acclaim for their innovative use of language, blend of historical and cultural themes, and exploration of complex social and political issues. His novels have been praised for their intellectual depth, emotional resonance, and narrative complexity.

However, Rushdie's works have also been criticized for their perceived elitism, complexity, and use of magical realism. Some critics have argued that his novels are overly ambitious and lacking in coherence.

##Academic and other activities

Rushdie has been involved in various academic and cultural activities throughout his career. He has taught at several universities, including the University of East Anglia and the University of Emory. He has also been a visiting professor at several universities, including Harvard University and Yale University.

Rushdie has been a vocal advocate for freedom of speech and expression. He has been involved in various campaigns and organizations, including the PEN American Center and the Index on Censorship.

##Film and television

Rushdie's works have been adapted into several films and television series. "Midnight's Children" was adapted into a film in 2012, directed by Deepa Mehta. "The Satanic Verses" has been adapted into a television series, directed by Alexander Korda.

Rushdie has also worked as a screenwriter and producer on several films and television series. He has written screenplays for films such as "The Jaguar Smile" (1987) and "The Ground Beneath Her Feet" (2001).

#The Satanic Verses and the fatwā

##Failed assassination attempt (1989)

On February 14, 1989, Ayatollah Khomeini, the Supreme Leader of Iran, issued a fatwā calling for Rushdie's death due to the perceived blasphemy in "The Satanic Verses". Rushdie received death threats and was forced into hiding.

On August 3, 1989, Mustafa Mahmoud Mazeh, a Lebanese Hezbollah militant, attempted to assassinate Rushdie at a book signing event in London. Mazeh was killed in the attempt, and Rushdie was uninjured.

##Hezbollah's comments (2006)

In 2006, Hezbollah's leader, Hassan Nasrallah, reiterated the call for Rushdie's death, saying that the fatwā was still in effect.

##International Guerillas (1990)

In 1990, Rushdie published "International Guerillas," a collection of essays that explored the intersection of politics, culture, and literature in the context of the fatwā.

##Al-Qaeda hit list (2010)

In 2010, Al-Qaeda added Rushdie to its hit list, along with several other authors and intellectuals.

##Jaipur Literature Festival (2012)

In 2012, Rushdie was forced to cancel his appearance at the Jaipur Literature Festival in India due to security concerns.

##Chautauqua attack (2022)

On August 12, 2022, Rushdie was attacked on stage at the Chautauqua Institution in New York. He suffered serious injuries, including a punctured lung and damage to his liver.

#Awards, honours, and recognition

##Knighthood

Rushdie was knighted in 2007 for his services to literature.

#Religious and political beliefs

##Religious background

Rushdie was born into a Muslim family, but he has stated that he is an atheist.

##Political background

###UK politics

Rushdie has been a vocal critic of British politics, particularly with regards to issues such as immigration and multiculturalism.

###US politics

Rushdie has been a vocal critic of American politics, particularly with regards to issues such as the War on Terror and the presidency of Donald Trump.

###Against religious extremism

Rushdie has been a vocal critic of religious extremism, particularly with regards to issues such as the fatwā and the rise of Islamic fundamentalism.

###South Asian politics and Kashmir

Rushdie has been a vocal critic of South Asian politics, particularly with regards to issues such as the Kashmir conflict and the rise of Hindu nationalism in India.

#Personal life

Rushdie has been married four times: to Clarissa Luard, Marianne Wiggins, Elizabeth West, and Padma Lakshmi. He has two sons, Zafar and Milan.

2022 Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly election

The 2022 Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly election was held in the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh to elect 68 members of the Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly. The election was held on November 12, 2022, and the results were declared on December 8, 2022.

#Background

The Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly is the unicameral legislature of the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh. The assembly has 68 members, who are elected by the people of the state through a general election. The term of the assembly is five years, unless dissolved earlier.

##Bypolls and defections

In the 2022 election, there were several bypolls and defections that took place. The bypolls were held in the constituencies of Dharamshala, Pachhad, and Bhoranj. The Indian National Congress won two of the three seats, while the Bharatiya Janata Party won one. There were also several defections from the Indian National Congress to the Bharatiya Janata Party, which weakened the Congress party's chances in the election.

#Schedule

The election was scheduled to be held in a single phase on November 12, 2022. The counting of votes was held on December 8, 2022.

#Election statistics

According to the Election Commission of India, the total number of eligible voters in the state was 55,92,828. Out of these, 27,48,945 were male and 28,43,883 were female. The number of polling stations was 7,881.

#Parties and alliances

Several parties and alliances contested the election.

##National Democratic Alliance

The National Democratic Alliance (NDA) was led by the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). The BJP contested all 68 seats in the state. The other parties in the alliance were the Rashtriya Loktantrik Party (RLP) and the Lok Janshakti Party (LJP).

##United Progressive Alliance

The United Progressive Alliance (UPA) was led by the Indian National Congress (INC). The INC contested 68 seats in the state. The other parties in the alliance were the Himachal Vikas Congress (HVC) and the Communist Party of India (Marxist) (CPI(M)).

##Aam Aadmi Party

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) contested 67 seats in the state.

##Left Front

The Left Front was a coalition of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) (CPI(M)) and the Communist Party of India (CPI).

##Others

Other parties that contested the election included the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP), the Janta Dal (United) (JDU), and the Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD).

#Candidates

There were a total of 412 candidates who contested the election.

#Campaigns

The election campaigns were marked by heated rhetoric and personal attacks.

##Aam Aadmi Party

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) focused on the issues of corruption, unemployment, and inflation. The party promised to provide free healthcare and education to all citizens.

###Manifesto

The AAP released its manifesto on October 25, 2022. The manifesto promised to provide 300 units of free electricity to all households, waive off farm loans, and provide a guaranteed minimum income of ₹5,000 per month to all citizens.

##Bharatiya Janata Party

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) focused on the issues of development, national security, and Hindutva. The party promised to build a Ram temple in Ayodhya and to abrogate Article 370 of the Constitution.

###Manifesto

The BJP released its manifesto on October 28, 2022. The manifesto promised to provide 33% reservation to women in government jobs, to build a new international airport in the state, and to provide ₹1,000 crore for the development of the state's infrastructure.

##Indian National Congress

The Indian National Congress (INC) focused on the issues of employment, education, and healthcare. The party promised to provide 10 lakh jobs to the youth, to build 10 new medical colleges, and to provide free healthcare to all citizens.

###Manifesto

The INC released its manifesto on October 22, 2022. The manifesto promised to provide 50% reservation to women in government jobs, to waive off farm loans, and to provide a guaranteed minimum income of ₹5,000 per month to all citizens.

#Surveys and polls

Several surveys and polls were conducted before the election.

##Opinion polls

According to an opinion poll conducted by the India Today Group, the BJP was likely to win 38-42 seats, while the INC was likely to win 24-28 seats. The AAP was likely to win 2-4 seats.

##Exit polls

According to an exit poll conducted by the Republic TV, the BJP was likely to win 40-45 seats, while the INC was likely to win 22-25 seats. The AAP was likely to win 1-3 seats.

#Voter turnout

The voter turnout in the election was 75.6%.

#Results

The results of the election were declared on December 8, 2022.

##Results by alliance and party

The INC won 40 seats, while the BJP won 25 seats. The AAP won 0 seats.

##Results by division

The INC won 10 seats in the Kangra division, while the BJP won 5 seats. The AAP won 0 seats.

##Results by district

The INC won 5 seats in the Kangra district, while the BJP won 2 seats. The AAP won 0 seats.

Shakira: Bzrp Music Sessions, Vol. 53

Shakira: Bzrp Music Sessions, Vol. 53 is a song by Colombian singer Shakira and Argentine producer Bizarrap, released on January 11, 2023. The song marked Shakira's return to music after a hiatus and sparked widespread attention due to its lyrics, which many interpreted as a reference to her highly publicized breakup with Spanish footballer Gerard Piqué.

#Background

In 2022, Shakira announced that she would be taking a hiatus from music to focus on her health and personal life. However, she began working on new material in late 2022, collaborating with Argentine producer Bizarrap. The two artists had previously worked together on the song "Chantaje" in 2016. Bizarrap is known for his Bzrp Music Sessions series, which features collaborations with various artists.

#Release and promotion

Shakira: Bzrp Music Sessions, Vol. 53 was released on January 11, 2023, through various music streaming platforms. The song was announced on Shakira's social media accounts, generating significant buzz among fans and the media. The release was accompanied by a music video, which premiered on YouTube.

article:
2023 Ligas Departamentales del Perú

The 2023 Ligas Departamentales del Perú were the top-tier amateur football leagues of Peru. The tournaments were organized by the respective regional football associations and served as the qualifying stage for the 2023 Copa Perú.

# Liga Departamental de Amazonas

The 2023 Liga Departamental de Amazonas was the 53rd edition of the top division of football in the Amazonas Region of Peru.

## First stage

The first stage of the tournament featured 12 teams divided into two groups of six teams each. The teams played each other in a round-robin format, with the top two teams from each group advancing to the quarterfinals.

## Quarterfinals

The quarterfinals were played between the top two teams from each group, with the winners advancing to the semifinals.

## Semifinals

The semifinals were played between the winners of the quarterfinals, with the winners advancing to the final.

## Final

The final was played between the winners of the semifinals, with the winner being crowned the champion of the 2023 Liga Departamental de Amazonas.

# Liga Departamental de Áncash

The 2023 Liga Departamental de Áncash was the 53rd edition of the top division of football in the Ancash Region of Peru.

## First stage

The first stage of the tournament featured 16 teams divided into two groups of eight teams each. The teams played each other in a round-robin format, with the top four teams from each group advancing to the round of 16.

## Round of 16

The round of 16 was played between the top four teams from each group, with the winners advancing to the quarterfinals.

## Quarterfinals

The quarterfinals were played between the winners of the round of 16, with the winners advancing to the semifinals.

## Semifinals

The semifinals were played between the winners of the quarterfinals, with the winners advancing to the finals.

## Finals

The finals were played between the winners of the semifinals, with the winner being crowned the champion of the 2023 Liga Departamental de Áncash.

# Liga Departamental de Apurímac

The 2023 Liga Departamental de Apurímac was the 53rd edition of the top division of football in the Apurímac Region of Peru.

## First stage

The first stage of the tournament featured 10 teams divided into two groups of five teams each. The teams played each other in a round-robin format, with the top two teams from each group advancing to the quarterfinals.

## Quarterfinals

The quarterfinals were played between the top two teams from each group, with the winners advancing to the semifinals.

## Semifinals

The semifinals were played between the winners of the quarterfinals, with the winners advancing to the final.

## Final

The final was played between the winners of the semifinals, with the winner being crowned the champion of the 2023 Liga Departamental de Apurímac.

article:
2022 United States House of Representatives Elections in New York
=================================================================

The 2022 United States House of Representatives elections in New York were held on November 8, 2022, to elect the 26 U.S. Representatives from the state of New York, one from each of the state's 26 congressional districts. The elections coincided with the 2022 midterm elections and the 2022 New York gubernatorial election.

2020-22 Redistricting Controversy
-----------------------------

Following the 2020 United States Census, New York lost one congressional district, going from 27 to 26. The redistricting process was contentious, with multiple lawsuits and disagreements between Democrats and Republicans. The New York Court of Appeals ultimately threw out the Democratic-drawn maps, and a special master was appointed to redraw the districts. The new maps were finalized in May 2022.

Overview
--------

### Votes by Ballot Line

In New York, candidates can run on multiple ballot lines. The following table shows the number of votes received by each party's candidates in the general election.

| Party | Votes | Percentage |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Democratic | 2,434,111 | 51.1% |
| Republican | 1,975,111 | 41.5% |
| Conservative | 138,111 | 2.9% |
| Working Families | 114,111 | 2.4% |
| Libertarian | 21,111 | 0.4% |
| Green | 15,111 | 0.3% |
| Independence | 12,111 | 0.3% |
| Other | 10,111 | 0.2% |

### Votes by District

The following table shows the number of votes received by each party's candidates in each congressional district.

| District | Democratic | Republican | Conservative | Working Families | Libertarian | Green | Independence | Other |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | 143,111 | 121,111 | 10,111 | 8,111 | 2,111 | 1,111 | 1,111 | 1,111 |
| 2 | 141,111 | 123,111 | 9,111 | 7,111 | 2,111 | 1,111 | 1,111 | 1,111 |
| 3 | 139,111 | 125,111 | 8,111 | 6,111 | 2,111 | 1,111 | 1,111 | 1,111 |
| ... | ... | ... | ... | ... | ... | ... | ... | ... |
| 26 | 151,111 | 129,111 | 11,111 | 9,111 | 3,111 | 2,111 | 2,111 | 2,111 |

### Seat Allocation

The following table shows the number of seats won by each party in the general election.

| Party | Seats |
| --- | --- |
| Democratic | 15 |
| Republican | 11 |
